bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 27, 1920

div1.p: Blue requests that Carter assist in the revision of U.S. quarantine regulations.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 27, 1920
div1.opener:
SJH
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
F.
Misc.
Orders
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 27, 1920.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
You are hereby detailed a member of a board to revise the
Quarantine Regulations of the United States and will report at
the Bureau on the 27th inst., for initial meeting of the board.
You will continue on duty in this particular as long as may be
necessary for the proper revision of these regulations. While
absent from Baltimore your status will be that of special tem-
porary duty. A copy of order convening the board is trans-
mitted for your information.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. J
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing instruc-
tions are hereby authorized.
J Moyle
Assistant Secretary.
R B
✓
Inc.
